# goingdark.social Wiki

Welcome to the **goingdark.social** community wiki. This is a collaborative documentation space maintained by and for our community members.

## About This Wiki

This wiki contains:

- Server rules and guidelines
- Privacy and moderation policies
- Getting started guides
- Community resources
- Technical documentation

## Quick Links

Browse the documentation using the sidebar navigation, or jump to these popular pages:

- [Getting Started](/wiki/getting-started) - New to Mastodon or our instance?
- [Server Rules](/wiki/rules) - Community guidelines
- [Privacy Policy](/wiki/privacy) - How we handle your data
- [Moderation](/wiki/moderation) - Our moderation approach

<Callout type="info" title="Community Maintained">
This wiki is maintained by the community. If you'd like to contribute or suggest improvements, please contact the admin team.
</Callout>

## About goingdark.social

**goingdark.social** is a privacy-focused Mastodon instance. We're part of the Fediverse, a decentralized social network that puts users first.

### Our Values

- **Privacy First** - Your data belongs to you
- **Community Driven** - Governed by and for our members
- **Open & Transparent** - Open source and openly moderated
- **Respectful** - A safe space for meaningful conversation

## Need Help?

- **Email:** admin@goingdark.social
- **Mastodon:** @admin@goingdark.social

We typically respond within 24-48 hours.

import Callout from '../../components/mdx/CalloutWrapper.astro';

# Getting Started

Welcome to goingdark.social! This guide will help you get started on our Mastodon instance.

## What is Mastodon?

Mastodon is a free, open-source social network. Unlike centralized platforms, Mastodon is **decentralized** - it consists of many independent servers (instances) that communicate with each other.

### Key Features

- **Decentralized** - No single company owns the network
- **Open Source** - Code is publicly available and auditable
- **No Ads** - Your timeline isn't cluttered with advertisements
- **Chronological Timeline** - No algorithmic manipulation
- **500 Character Limit** - More room to express yourself
- **Content Warnings** - Hide sensitive content behind warnings

## Creating Your Account

1. Visit [goingdark.social](https://goingdark.social)
2. Click "Create account"
3. Choose a username and strong password
4. Enter your email address
5. Read and accept our [server rules](/wiki/rules)
6. Verify your email

<Callout type="tip" title="Username Tips">
Your username will be **@username@goingdark.social**. Choose something you'll be happy with long-term, as changing it later can be confusing for followers.
</Callout>

## Setting Up Your Profile

After creating your account:

1. **Upload an Avatar** - Click your profile and choose "Edit profile"
2. **Add a Header Image** - Make your profile visually appealing
3. **Write a Bio** - Tell people about yourself (500 characters)
4. **Add Metadata** - Include links, pronouns, or other info

## Your First Post

Ready to post? Here's how:

1. Click the compose box (top left or center, depending on view)
2. Write your post (up to 500 characters)
3. Choose visibility:
   - **Public** - Visible to everyone
   - **Unlisted** - Not shown in public timelines
   - **Followers** - Only your followers see it
   - **Direct** - Only mentioned users see it
4. Click "Post"

<Callout type="info" title="Content Warnings">
Use content warnings (CW) for potentially sensitive topics like politics, food, mental health, or spoilers. It's a courtesy that helps others control what they see.
</Callout>

## Understanding Timelines

Mastodon has three main timelines:

- **Home** - Posts from people you follow
- **Local** - Public posts from goingdark.social users
- **Federated** - Public posts from across the Fediverse

## Finding People to Follow

- Browse the **Local** and **Federated** timelines
- Check who your follows are following
- Use hashtags to find people with similar interests
- Look at the **Explore** page for trending posts

## Mastodon Etiquette

- Use content warnings appropriately
- Add alt text to images for accessibility
- Use hashtags (they're the only way to make posts discoverable)
- Be respectful and follow our [server rules](/wiki/rules)
- Don't engage with harassers - report and block them

## Mobile Apps

Mastodon has excellent mobile apps:

- **Official Mastodon App** (iOS & Android)
- **Tusky** (Android)
- **Toot!** (iOS)
- **Moshidon** (Android)
- **Ice Cubes** (iOS)

## Need Help?

If you have questions:

1. Check this wiki for guides
2. Ask in your timeline - our community is friendly!
3. Contact the admin team at admin@goingdark.social

<Callout type="success" title="Welcome to the Fediverse!">
You're now part of a global network of independent social media communities. Enjoy meaningful conversations free from corporate control!
</Callout>
Community guidelines and rules for goingdark.social

import Callout from '../../components/mdx/CalloutWrapper.astro';

# Server Rules

Welcome to goingdark.social. To maintain a healthy, safe, and inclusive community, all members must follow these rules.

<Callout type="warning">
  Violation of these rules may result in warnings, temporary suspension, or permanent ban depending on severity.
</Callout>

## Core Rules

### 1. Be Respectful

Treat others with dignity and respect. We're all here to connect and share ideas.

- No harassment, bullying, or personal attacks
- Respect people's identities, pronouns, and boundaries
- Disagree constructively without being disagreeable

### 2. No Hate Speech or Discrimination

We have zero tolerance for content that promotes hatred or discrimination.

- No racism, sexism, homophobia, transphobia, or ableism
- No promotion of hate groups or extremist ideologies
- No dehumanizing language or slurs

### 3. No Illegal Content

Do not post content that is illegal in our server's jurisdiction.

- No sharing of copyrighted material without permission
- No promotion of illegal activities
- No content involving minors in any inappropriate context

### 4. Content Warnings & NSFW

Help others curate their experience with proper content warnings.

- Use Content Warnings (CW) for sensitive topics
- Mark sexually explicit content as sensitive/NSFW
- CW suggested for: violence, politics, mental health, food, etc.

### 5. No Spam or Malicious Behavior

Keep the community genuine and safe.

- No excessive cross-posting or automated spam
- No malware, phishing, or scams
- No cryptocurrency scams or pump-and-dump schemes
- No engagement farming or manipulation

### 6. Privacy and Consent

Respect others' privacy and personal boundaries.

- Don't share others' personal information (doxxing)
- Don't screenshot and share private posts without consent
- Respect "followers only" and unlisted post visibility

### 7. No Misinformation

Especially regarding health, safety, and current events.

- Don't spread deliberate misinformation
- Fact-check before sharing, especially news
- Note when something is speculation or opinion

### 8. Alt Text for Images

Make content accessible to everyone.

- Add descriptive alt text to images when possible
- This helps visually impaired users and improves the community for everyone

## Moderation Guidelines

### We Will Act On

- Reports from community members
- Content that violates server rules
- Patterns of problematic behavior
- Federation issues with other instances

### Moderator Actions

1. **Warning**: First offense for minor violations
2. **Temporary Silence**: Limited reach for repeated issues
3. **Temporary Suspension**: Time-limited account suspension
4. **Permanent Ban**: Severe or repeated violations

### Appeals

If you believe a moderation action was taken in error:

1. Email admin@goingdark.social
2. Include your username and the action taken
3. Explain your perspective calmly
4. Wait for a response (usually within 48 hours)

## Federation Policy

### We Defederate From

- Instances that allow illegal content
- Instances with poor or no moderation
- Instances promoting hate speech
- Instances that enable harassment campaigns

### Limited Federation

Some instances may be limited (silenced) rather than fully blocked, meaning:
- Their content doesn't appear in public timelines
- You can still follow users from these instances if you choose

## Reporting

If you see content that violates these rules:

1. Use the **Report** function in Mastodon
2. Select which rule(s) are being violated
3. Add any relevant context
4. Our moderation team will review within 24 hours

<Callout type="info">
  When in doubt, report it. False positives are fine; we'd rather investigate than miss something important.
</Callout>

## Additional Guidelines

### Bots and Automation

- Bot accounts must be marked as bots
- Must not spam or excessively post
- Must follow all other server rules
- Approval required for high-frequency posting

### Commercial Use

- Light self-promotion is okay
- Excessive advertising is not
- No cryptocurrency promotion or NFT shilling
- Affiliate links should be disclosed

### Account Squatting

- Don't register accounts you won't use
- Don't impersonate others
- Parody accounts must be clearly marked

## Philosophy

Our rules exist to create a space where people can express themselves freely while respecting others. We believe in:

- **Privacy over profit** - Your data is yours
- **Safety over growth** - We'd rather be small and safe than large and toxic
- **Community over algorithms** - People matter more than engagement metrics

## Updates

These rules may be updated as needed. Major changes will be announced to all users.

**Last Updated**: November 2024

---

Questions about the rules? Contact @admin@goingdark.social or email admin@goingdark.social
How we handle and protect your data on goingdark.social

import Callout from '../../components/mdx/CalloutWrapper.astro';

# Privacy Policy

**Effective Date**: November 2024
**Last Updated**: November 2024

## Introduction

At goingdark.social, your privacy is our priority. This policy explains what data we collect, why we collect it, how we use it, and your rights regarding your data.

<Callout type="info">
  We are committed to transparency. If you have questions about this policy, contact admin@goingdark.social
</Callout>

## What Information We Collect

### Account Information

When you create an account, we collect:

- **Username**: Your chosen handle on goingdark.social
- **Email address**: For account verification, password resets, and important notifications
- **Password**: Stored encrypted using industry-standard hashing
- **Display name and bio**: Optional profile information you provide
- **Profile pictures**: Avatar and header images you upload

### Content You Create

- **Posts (toots)**: Public, unlisted, followers-only, and direct messages
- **Media**: Images, videos, and audio files you upload
- **Interactions**: Favorites, boosts, bookmarks, follows, and blocks

### Automatically Collected Information

- **IP Address**: Used for security and anti-abuse measures
- **Browser information**: User agent string for compatibility
- **Access times**: When you log in and use the service

### Optional Information

- **Profile fields**: Website, location, or custom fields you add
- **Two-factor authentication**: If you enable 2FA for security

## How We Use Your Information

### To Provide the Service

- Deliver your posts to followers
- Display your public profile
- Enable federation with other Mastodon/ActivityPub instances

### Security and Abuse Prevention

- Prevent spam and automated abuse
- Enforce server rules and terms of service
- Protect against unauthorized access

### Communication

- Send important service announcements
- Respond to support requests
- Notify about moderation actions (if applicable)

### Legal Compliance

- Respond to valid legal requests
- Comply with applicable laws and regulations

## Data Sharing and Federation

### The Fediverse

Mastodon is a federated network. This means:

- **Public posts** are visible to anyone and are shared with other instances
- **Unlisted posts** don't appear in public timelines but are still publicly accessible
- **Followers-only posts** are shared only with your followers' instances
- **Direct messages** are sent to recipient instances (not end-to-end encrypted)

<Callout type="warning">
  Direct messages on Mastodon are **not end-to-end encrypted**. Instance admins can technically access them. Don't share highly sensitive information via DMs.
</Callout>

### Third Parties We Don't Share With

We **DO NOT**:

- Sell your data to advertisers
- Share your data with data brokers
- Use tracking pixels or advertising networks
- Employ analytics services that track you across sites

### When We Must Share

We may share information only when:

- Required by law (valid court order or subpoena)
- Necessary to prevent harm or illegal activity
- With your explicit consent

## Your Rights

### Access and Portability

- **Download your data**: Export all your posts, media, and account data
- **Access your information**: Request a copy of what we have

### Control

- **Delete posts**: Remove individual posts at any time
- **Delete account**: Permanently delete your account and associated data
- **Edit profile**: Update your information whenever you want

### Privacy Settings

You control:

- Post visibility (public, unlisted, followers-only, direct)
- Who can follow you (open or approval required)
- Whether your account appears in the directory
- Whether search engines can index your profile

## Data Retention

### Active Accounts

- Posts and media: Retained as long as your account is active
- IP logs: Retained for 90 days for security purposes
- Email logs: Retained for 30 days

### Deleted Content

- **Deleted posts**: Removed from our server and deletion requests sent to federated instances
- **Deleted accounts**: All data removed within 30 days
- **Federated content**: We request deletion from other instances, but cannot guarantee removal

<Callout type="info">
  Once content is federated to other instances, we cannot control their retention policies. Choose your privacy settings carefully.
</Callout>

## Security Measures

We implement security measures including:

- **Encrypted passwords**: Using bcrypt hashing
- **HTTPS**: All connections encrypted in transit
- **Secure server infrastructure**: Regular security updates and monitoring
- **Limited access**: Only authorized admins can access the database
- **Regular backups**: Encrypted and securely stored

### What We Can't Protect Against

- Compromised passwords (use a strong, unique password)
- Data already federated to other instances
- Screenshots or archives of your public posts

## Cookies and Tracking

### What We Use

- **Session cookies**: To keep you logged in (essential)
- **Preference cookies**: To remember your settings (optional)

### What We Don't Use

- No advertising cookies
- No third-party tracking cookies
- No analytics that track you across sites

## Children's Privacy

goingdark.social is not intended for users under 13 years old. We do not knowingly collect data from children under 13. If we learn we have collected such data, we will delete it promptly.

## International Data Transfers

Our servers are located in [Server Location]. By using goingdark.social, you consent to your data being processed in this jurisdiction.

## Changes to This Policy

We may update this policy to reflect:

- Changes in laws or regulations
- New features or services
- Feedback from the community

**When we make changes:**
- We'll update the "Last Updated" date
- Major changes will be announced to all users
- Continued use after changes means acceptance

## Data Breach Notification

In the event of a data breach:

1. We'll investigate immediately
2. Affected users will be notified within 72 hours
3. We'll provide details about what data was affected
4. We'll explain steps being taken to address the breach

## Your Choices

### Minimize Data Collection

- Use a pseudonymous username
- Don't include personal information in your bio
- Use privacy settings to limit who sees your posts

### Leave the Platform

You can delete your account at any time:

1. Go to Settings → Account → Delete Account
2. Confirm your decision
3. Your data will be permanently removed within 30 days

## Contact Information

**For privacy concerns:**
- Email: privacy@goingdark.social
- Mastodon: @admin@goingdark.social

**For data requests:**
- Email: admin@goingdark.social with subject "Data Request"

## Legal Basis (GDPR)

For users in the EU/EEA, we process data based on:

- **Contract**: To provide the service you signed up for
- **Legitimate interest**: Security, abuse prevention, service improvement
- **Legal obligation**: Compliance with laws
- **Consent**: For optional features you enable

## Third-Party Services

We use minimal third-party services:

- **Server hosting**: [Hosting Provider Name]
- **Email delivery**: For transactional emails only
- **Backups**: Encrypted and stored securely

These services are bound by contract to protect your data and not use it for other purposes.

---

## Summary (TL;DR)

✅ We collect only what's needed to run the service
✅ We never sell or share your data with advertisers
✅ You control your privacy settings and can delete everything
✅ Public posts are federated across the Mastodon network
⚠️ Direct messages are not end-to-end encrypted
⚠️ We can't control what other instances do with federated data

Questions? Contact admin@goingdark.social
